message_1: What is the chemical equation for the complete combustion of propane (C3H8) and what are the products produced in this reaction?
message_2:
The chemical equation for the complete combustion of propane (C3H8) is:

C3H8 + 5O2 â†’ 3CO2 + 4H2O

In this reaction, propane (C3H8) reacts with oxygen (O2) to produce carbon dioxide (CO2) and water (H2O).
